Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the extent to which every single Republican and Democratic president in the past half-century has taken the same kinds of actions.
Understate: The claim may understate the concerns raised by critics about the legality of the actions taken by Obama.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient evidence or support to fully prove that every single president in the past half-century has taken the same actions.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the actions taken by every single Republican and Democratic president in the past half-century are comparable, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or interpretations for the historical precedent and examples provided, suggesting that the claim is not the only possible explanation.
